<!-- 1. Log in to that blog as an administrator. -->
<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the blog's admin panels (or Manage: Import in older versions of WordPress). -->
<!-- 3. Choose "WordPress" from the list. -->
<!-- 4. Upload this file using the form provided on that page. -->

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/10/30/safecss/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[a img {
border:none;
}

#content img {
margin:5px;
}

body {
background:#fff url('./images/bg.png') repeat-x;
color:#666;
font-family:Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
font-size:62.5%;
line-height:1.5;
text-align:center;
border-top-width:thin;
border-top-style:solid;
border-top-color:#CCCCCC;
margin:0;
padding:0;
}

#wrap {
text-align:left;
width:76em;
margin:0 auto;
}

#content {
font-size:1.2em;
float:left;
width:500px;
border:thin solid #CCCCCC;
padding:15px;
}

#sidebar {
font-size:1.1em;
float:right;
width:200px;
list-style:none;
margin:0;
padding:2em 0 0;
}

#header {
padding:3em 1em;
}

#footer {
background:#ffffff;
border-top:1px dotted #666666;
color:#ffffff;
clear:both;
font-size:.9em;
padding:.5em;
}

h1,h2,h3 {
font-family:Georgia, Times New Roman, Times, serif;
font-weight:normal;
letter-spacing:0;
margin:0;
}

#header h1 {
font-family:Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
font-size:3em;
margin:0 1em 0 0;
}

#header h1 a {
color:#000000;
}

#header h1 a:hover {
color:#000000;
}

#header p {
color:#666666;
font-size:1.1em;
margin:-.5em 0 0;
}

.entrytitle h2 {
font-size:2.2em;
}

.entrytitle h2 a {
color:#000000;
}

.entrytitle h2 a:hover {
color:#000000;
}

.entrytitle h3 {
font-size:1.8em;
color:#666666;
}

#sidebar h3 {
color:#000000;
font-size:1.5em;
margin:1em 0;
}

.entry {
margin-bottom:3em;
}

.sticky {
background:#666666;
padding:5px 10px 10px;
}

.entrymeta {
font-size:.9em;
clear:both;
}

.postedby {
background:#fff url('./images/user.gif') no-repeat;
padding:3px 3px 3px 20px;
}

.filedto {
background:#fff url('./images/post.gif') no-repeat;
padding:3px 3px 3px 20px;
}

.commentslink {
background:#fff url('./images/packaged.gif') no-repeat;
padding:3px 3px 3px 20px;
}

.sticky .entrymeta span,.sticky .entrymeta a {
background-color:transparent;
}

#sidebar ul {
list-style-type:none;
margin:0;
padding:0;
}

#sidebar ul ul {
margin-left:10px;
}

#sidebar ul li {
border-bottom:1px dotted #666666;
margin-bottom:.3em;
padding:.3em;
}

.commentsblock {
margin:.5em;
padding:1em;
}

.commentsblock textarea {
width:100%;
}

.commentsblock input,.commentsblock textarea {
border:1px solid #666666;
}

.commentsblock textarea:focus {
background:#eee;
border:1px solid #a1a1a1;
}

.commentsblock textarea:focus,.commentsblock input:focus {
background:#eee;
border:1px solid #a1a1a1;
}

.commentauthor {
display:block;
font-size:1.5em;
}

ol.commentlist {
color:#666666;
font-size:.9em;
list-style-type:none;
margin:1.5em 0 0;
padding:0;
}

.commentlist li {
margin-bottom:.5em;
list-style-type:none;
padding:.5em 1em;
}

.commentlist li .avatar {
float:right;
border:1px dotted #666666;
padding:2px;
}

.thread-alt {
background:#666666;
border:1px dotted #666666;
padding:.5em;
}

h3#comments {
font-size:1.6em;
}

a {
color:#000000;
text-decoration:none;
}

a:hover {
color:#000000;
}

#content img.centered,#content img.aligncenter {
display:block;
margin-left:auto;
margin-right:auto;
}

img.alignright {
display:inline;
margin:0 0 2px 7px;
padding:4px;
}

img.alignleft {
display:inline;
margin:0 7px 2px 0;
padding:4px;
}

.alignright {
float:right;
}

.alignleft {
float:left;
}

.aligncenter,div.aligncenter {
display:block;
margin-left:auto;
margin-right:auto;
}

.wp-caption {
border:1px solid #ddd;
text-align:center;
background-color:#666666;
padding-top:4px;
-moz-border-radius:3px;
-khtml-border-radius:3px;
-webkit-border-radius:3px;
border-radius:3px;
margin:10px;
}

.wp-caption img {
border:0 none;
margin:0;
padding:0;
}

.wp-caption p.wp-caption-text {
font-size:11px;
line-height:17px;
margin:0;
padding:0 4px 5px;
}]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>I Can&#039;t Believe It&#039;s The...</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/11/20/i-cant-believe-its-the/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Nov 2009 17:04:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Misc.]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="misc"><![CDATA[Misc.]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=92</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I have been meaning to do this for so long, but today ( mainly because I am bored of doing all other uni work) I have  finished setting up my blog.

The grand plan is to use this blog so that I can coherently keep a record of all my thoughts, ideas and inspirations as I go through my second year of uni. I initially wanted to have this finished by the start of term so i could have a full account of the year ahead but unfortunately that has not happened! but better late than never.

<p>&nbsp;</p>

]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>The Story So Far... </title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/11/20/the-story-so-far/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Nov 2009 17:35:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Misc.]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="misc"><![CDATA[Misc.]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=94</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This semister we have three quite different projects on the go;

<strong>1. PDP</strong>

This is the subject that brought me round to the idea of creating this blog.  To complete the module we need to keep a journal of our year at uni and try our best to piece together the creative thoughts we have as a way of explaining our work. Unfortunately my handwriting is barely legible and I have a tendency to loose note books so I came to the logical conclusion to post it on the web.

Aswel as the journal I need to write an illustrated essay based on one of six essay questions and give two presentations.

<strong>2. Development of Graphical Media Process</strong>

For the main part of the semester ( 50% of the mark) I have to " Create an innovative Selection of print based publicity material for the <a title="trumanbrewery" href="http://www.trumanbrewery.com/" target="_blank">Old Truman Brewery</a> - Cultural Arts Centre London E1"

This translates to a new; Visual Identify, Events Broadsheet, Invitation Card and  Guide Booklet.

<strong>3.Photography</strong>

Finally this semester we have a photography task. but that doesn't start till next wee so more about that to come...

<p> </p>

]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Two Week Starter Project</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/11/20/two-week-starter-projectan/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Nov 2009 17:48:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[My Work]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="my-work"><![CDATA[My Work]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=96</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Back in September we were given a two week starter project to ease us back into work.

The Brief was to create a postcard that reflects what you are like, but the catch is it must illustrate all eight of the following points.
<ol>
<li>An object or heirloom of significant importance</li>
<li>An important date</li>
<li>A luxury you cant live without</li>
<li>A favourite food</li>
<li>An old family photograph</li>
<li>A birthmark/scar</li>
<li>A favourite fictional character</li>
<li>A pet aversion ( the thing you most love to hate)</li>
</ol>
[gallery] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>96</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-11-20 17:48:36</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

		<item>
		<title>New York New York!!</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/11/20/new-york-new-york/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Nov 2009 20:28:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[PDP]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="pdp"><![CDATA[PDP]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=188</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I was lucky enough to be whisked away to NewYork last week to celebrate my 21st birthday. Seeing as it is unlikely that I will be able to go again with the rest of my university class early next year I have tried to make the most of the opportunity this time round.I managed to visit the Museum of Art and Design, which I thoroughly enjoyed. One thing that did strike me about american museums is that they all seem to charge entrance fees. This seemed very unnatural from a british perspective seeing that the large majority of museums in the UK, and in Europe are donation based.

Ghost Stories - Nendo

One of my favorite exhibitions from the museum was “Ghost Stories” by Nendo. It consisted of several chairs aligned randomly on the floor. But due to a very clever bi of design he managed to substitute the wooden legs of the chair with plastic giving the illusion of the chairs floating in a eire mist. I think the reason I liked this piece so much is that it appears to trick the eye. At first glance you see chairs and wonder how the effect has been achieved. The use of contrasting materials and the process of allowing the audience to second guess your work is defiantly a quality I would like to achieve in some of my designs.

This Is For You - Rob Ryan

The second exhibition found interesting was that of Rob Ryan. Ryan had several piece on show but my favorite was a two story window hanging. I think that drew my attention first was the pure scale of the piece, the second was its intricacy. Although the media used was simple, the detail was not. What I liked most about the piece, apart from the elegance of the design its self, was the way it looked in the light. Because of the cutting you saw both the designs, media behind it (the window) and the shadow it cast.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>188</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2009-11-20 20:28:01</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-11-20 20:28:01</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>new-york-new-york</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>The Truman Gallery </title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/12/09/the-truman/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Dec 2009 23:27:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Graphic Media Development]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="graphic-media-development"><![CDATA[Graphic Media Development]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/12/09/the-truman/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The main project we are working on this semester is the rebranding of the Old Truman Gallery in bricklane, the gallery hosts wide range of events and exhibitons through out the year, and is rewnond for it's colourful cultural heritage. The site where the gallery now stands has it's roots burried deep in the history of the east end. 

Very much a working class part of London the site started it's days as the name suggests. Taking advantage of the cheap migrant labour the Black Eagle brewery was founded in the 1800's but the first reference to a brewery in the area can be traced back joesph truman, who in 1966 joined the bucknell brewery house of bricklane The brewery really began to make it's mark when the Huguenot imigrants introduced a breverage brewed using fermented hops, on the back of this success the black eagle quickly grew to be one of the largest breweries in the country. 

Over the years the area has benifted from the mixing pot of different cultures begining with Huguenot refugees spreading from Spitalfields, in the 17th century. Who where in turn followed by the irish, Ashkenazi Jews and, in the last century, Bangladeshis migrants.

All of these cultural influence can be seen in the local area and is reflected in the modern Truman gallery.     ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>104</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2009-12-09 23:27:09</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2009-12-09 23:27:09</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>the-truman</wp:post_name>

		<item>
		<title>Muesum Research</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/12/10/muesum-research/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 10 Dec 2009 00:33:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Graphic Media Development]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="graphic-media-development"><![CDATA[Graphic Media Development]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Inspiration]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="inspiration"><![CDATA[Inspiration]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[My Work]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="my-work"><![CDATA[My Work]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/2009/12/10/muesum-research/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In an attempt to better understand the brief I have set about researching the graphic elements which are uses to construct the identity of a few muesums that take there branding as seriously as the work they exhibit. The four I have choosen all go about this in different ways but one resounding simularty is that however stricking the branding is, it never detracts from the art.

<strong>Whitechapel Gallery<span style="font-weight:normal;"> </span></strong>

The White Chapel Gallery has been described as the “Original East End Gallery”. Located on the north side of Whitechapel high street, in the london borough of Tower Hamlets, Its shares much of the same cultural history as the old truman brewery. On our trip down to london the Whitechappel gallery was one of places of interest highest on my list. Designed by Charles Harrison Townsend it was founded in 1901 as one of the first publicly-funded galleries for temporary exhibitions in London, it has a strong track record for education and outreach projects, now focused on the Whitechapel area's deprived populations. It exhibits the work of contemporary artists, as well as organising retrospective exhibitions and shows that are of interest to the local community. Because of these similarities and the fact that the gallery has been recently renovated and given a fresh graphic identity I have choose it as one of my galleries to study.

<strong>Type Face.</strong>

The Gallery uses a sans serif pixelated type face for their logo and headline text. I think this reflects the contemporary nature of the work exhibited in the gallery as well as completing the relative minimalist interior. This type face is often reversed out against a grey or pastel colour background.

<strong>Logo Design</strong>

The logo makes use of the same font seen though out the print and web material. It is centred  both horizontally and vertically within a landscape oblong box. The text is reversed out against the colour of the box. To give the logo a square appearance the main box has a second box directly underneath it which is approximately half the hight of the first box.  I think the logo works really well because it gives the text space which adds to the overall feel of the identity.

<strong>Layout</strong>

The layout of the material follows a lot of the same rules as the in the previous points. It has a modern use of geometric shapes with square playing an important role.There is also a sophisticated use of white space, one of the key elements to the identity is the positioning of key elements. The double box is always horizontally centred but left aligned.

<a href="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2009/12/whitechapel_poster.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-161" title="Whitechapel_poster" src="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2009/12/whitechapel_poster.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="212" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Logo Development</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/01/15/125/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Jan 2010 23:24:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Graphic Media Development]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="graphic-media-development"><![CDATA[Graphic Media Development]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/01/15/125/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is just a quick update on my logo development. After much consideration and a lot of indecision I have come to the conclusion that my new identity for the Truman Brewery needs a strong mark. I have tried to capitalise on the quality of the type face I am using. I was hoping that just the pure fact of writing the name of the gallery in the font that is gill, would be enough to fill the mind of the viewer, (Consciously or unconsciously) with connotations of all things british. but unfortunately, for a number of reasons, (mainly the stipulation in the brief that I must create a logo) that the design is lacking.

My alternative is to introduce a mark which is instantly recognisable that I can use in a more subtle way to embed the brand of the gallery on different aspects of the brief.  I have settled with the silhouette of a water-lily. It is my best attempt so far to marry the british and asian cultures of the local area. I am still undecided on a colour, for the time being I will replicate the logo in all 5 of the colours used.

<a href="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/01/lotus_colour2.jpg"><img src="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/01/lotus_colour2.jpg?w=300" alt="" title="Water Lily Colour" width="300" height="132" class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-123" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>A3_Poster_Slim</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=129</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 01 Feb 2010 19:51:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[1]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="1"><![CDATA[1]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/02/a3_poster_slim.pdf</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Poster</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/02/01/the-poster/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 01 Feb 2010 19:51:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[1]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="1"><![CDATA[1]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/02/01/the-poster/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Again it has been to long between posts but as a quick update this is the latest version of my poster design. the brief for the design is a A3 poster which folds down to A5 size. The front must promote an event from one of the months listing. In this case the showing of the film 'The Krays' at the 'Old Trumen' (new name by the way) the back must be a list of the full months events. I've tried to stick to the same colour palate as list before using the pink for the cinema events. See the link below for a look.

<a href='http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/02/a3_poster_slim2.pdf'>A3_Poster_Slim2</a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>130</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-02-01 19:51:15</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-02-01 19:51:15</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>the-poster</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1265645538]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[10536232]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>A3_Poster_Slim2</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/02/01/the-poster/a3_poster_slim2/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 01 Feb 2010 23:21:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[1]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="1"><![CDATA[1]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/02/a3_poster_slim2.pdf</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Old Truman</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[After a very hectic week, my main project for semester one is finished and handed in! I just wanted to post the digital versions of the final pieces. Pack Shoots of the physicals copies will have to come at a later date.

<a href="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/02/a3_poster_cinema.pdf">A3_Poster_Cinema</a>

		<item>
		<title>Old Truman Evaluation</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/02/12/old-truman-evaluation/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 12 Feb 2010 04:56:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=199</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Old Truman Evaluation

Overall I have been very pleased with my progress on the main project for semester one. The real guts of the project was to try and get a sense of what brick lane was then and what is now. And Ultimately translate that into a coherent brand. I tried to stay with a very clean set of designs because I wanted to steer away from the temptations of over complicating the final work with grunge textures and backgrounds. I think that its was a good progression for me too, Mainly because it was a lot harder to make something like sophisticated than to make it look trendy. I think this move can really summaries the direction that my design focus has been moving in for the last couple of months.

I have been trying to concentrate on the benefits of using grids systems when flowing text into document in indesign.  As well as some of the more technical aspects of typography. One of my biggest achievements I feel is that I have come up with a unique way of presenting the folding poster. By using a slim design and aligning the text I have achieved legibility on both surfaces when closed. (As apposed to the writing being upside down) I Was also very pleased with the colour palette I used through out the project. I think that this was one of the strongest elements of the the brand identity

Areas where I could have improved through out the project was my ability to record my progression as I went along. I found myself spending hours in front of the computer tweaking designs without properly recording the development. I think that this could be detrimental to my final grade as it is a key aspect of the design process.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>Takeaway Packaging</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/02/19/takeaway-packaging/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Feb 2010 16:38:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[My Work]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="my-work"><![CDATA[My Work]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=143</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Just as a way of capping the last semesters terrible blog keeping, I am posting my first and last post on the take away seafood packaging support module. Here is the final  pack shoot of the packaging.

<a href="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/02/packshot.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-144 alignleft" title="Packshot" src="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/02/packshot.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="212" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>143</wp:post_id>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Great Speeches of the 20th Century </title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/02/19/great-speeches-of-the-20th-century/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Feb 2010 17:12:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[1]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="1"><![CDATA[1]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=147</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Confirmation of Graphic Media Practice.</strong>

Starting how I mean to carry on, this is the brief for my main project in semester two.

<strong>Great Speeches of the 20th century</strong>

The guardian newspaper brought together a collection of the greatest speeches of the twentieth Century. Each booklet contains an historical address and coverage of the speech from the time. The speeches are introduced by prominent figures ranging from FW de Klerck on Nelson Manuela's statement to the Rivonia trial to Mikhail Gorbachev on Nikitat Kruschev’s denunciation of Stalin.

The Brief: You are to select a minimum of three speeches. Consider the format that a ‘container of information’ can be; a book, booklet/pamphlet, broadsheet, pocket book, 3D object, artist-book, or photo book etc. Your design solutions could be combine illustration and/or your own/sourced photographs with the text, or it could be purely typographical or purely image based solution. Your design must work across the total collection of fourteen speeches. You are also to design the package/container/wrapper for all fourteen speeches (therefore you will need to make blind dummies for the whole series) these ‘books’ would be sold as a total collection in a selected shops such as the TATE or they may be designed as one off pieces.

This project is designed to allow you to develop your strengths and personal interests. If your passion is photography let the project be led by image, if your passion is typography let the project be led by text. If your passion is for craft, let the project be led by the handmade, and so on. Your exploration of ideas should be exciting, stimulating and test the conventions of normally excepted formats

Addition research in 3 key areas will be helpful:
<ol>
	<li>Content: the time frame in which the speeches was written, the speaker, the country of origin, social/cultural/political context.</li>
	<li>Physical structure: formats, materials, textures and processes.</li>
	<li>Working processes: technical application relating to typography, print specification, illustration, photography, 3D structures.</li>
</ol>
<strong>Speeches</strong>

Winston Churchill
<strong><em>We shall fight on the beaches </em></strong>
This is the edited text of the speech delivered to House of Commons on June 4 1940.

John F Kennedy
<strong><em>Ask not what your country can do for you </em></strong>
This speech was delivered by Kennedy at his presidential inauguration on January 20 1961.

Nelson Mandela
<strong><em>An ideal for which I am prepared to die </em></strong>
This is the full text of Mandela's statement from the dock at the opening of his trial on charges of sabotage, supreme court of South Africa, Pretoria, April 20 1964.

Harold Macmillan
<strong><em>No going back </em></strong>
Douglas Hurd: In South Africa, Macmillan delivered one of the defining statements of British policy in the 20th century.

Franklin D Roosevelt
<strong><em>The only thing we have to fear is fear itself</em></strong>
This speech was delivered by Roosevelt at his inauguration in Washington on March 4 1933.

Nikita Khrushchev
<strong><em>The cult of the individual</em></strong>
This is an edited version of a speech delivered by Khrushchev to the 20th congress of the Communist party of the USSR in Moscow on February 25 1956.

Emmeline Pankhurst
<strong><em>Freedom or death </em></strong>
This is an edited version of a speech delivered by Pankhurst in Hartford, Connecticut on November 13 1913.

Martin Luther King
<strong><em>I have a dream </em></strong>
This speech was delivered by King on August 28 1963 at the Lincoln Memorial, Washington.

Charles de Gaulle
<strong><em>The flame of French resistance </em></strong>
These speeches were delivered by Charles de Gaulle and broadcast by the BBC in 1940.

Margaret Thatcher
<strong><em>The lady's not for turning </em></strong>
This speech was delivered to the Conservative party conference in Brighton on October 10 1980.

Jawaharlal Nehru
<strong><em>A Tryst with Destiny
</em></strong>This speech was delivered by Nehru to the Constituent Assembly of India in New Delhi on August 14 1947.

Virginia Woolf
<strong><em>Shakespeare's sister </em></strong>
Versions of this speech were delivered by Woolf at Girton and Newnham colleges, University of Cambridge, on October 20 &amp; 26 1928.

Aneurin Bevan
<strong><em>Weapons for squalid and trivial ends </em></strong>
This is an edited version of a speech delivered by Bevan to the House of Commons on December 5 1956.

Earl Spencer
<strong><em>The most hunted person of the modern age </em></strong>
This speech was delivered at the funeral of Diana, Princess of Wales, at Westminster Abbey on September 6 1997.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>147</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-02-19 17:12:51</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-02-19 17:12:51</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>great-speeches-of-the-20th-century</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1266599622]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[10536232]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Takeaway Packaging Evaluation</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/02/21/takeaway-packaging-evaluation/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 21 Feb 2010 05:36:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=202</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I found this Project particularly difficult to get into, and unfortunately we did not have much time. Because of the way the studio sessions where set up, we where only given the brief in the second half of the semester. This made it particular hard to fit in the necessary studio sessions. Despite these problems I feel that I learnt a lot about studio photography. We had a range of taught studio sessions as well as the opportunity to try it on our own.

It think one thing that I achieved in this project was the uniformity and branding of the products. I tried to make the products look very natural together and to keep a constant design running throughout. I did also try to experiment with the design of the the box but settled with a variation of a classic style.

Some of the aspects I found hard about the brief was actually constructing the boxes them selves. For a support module I felt that there was a lo of work involved. Because of the nature of the products the boxes had to a least a certain size so it was hard and expensive to have the graphics printed onto a sheet of paper big enough to accommodate the large net. There was also the added issues of double sided printing as well as the weight of the paper need to maintain the structure of the box. Over all I think one of the biggest lesson I have learnt from this brief is the ability to problem solve. For all the problems above a quick and cost effective solution had to be found. I hope that my final product reflect how this was achieved.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>202</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-02-21 05:36:00</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-02-21 05:36:00</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>takeaway-packaging-evaluation</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1273815395]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[10536232]]></wp:meta_value>

		<item>
		<title>One Day Project</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/03/03/one-day-project/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 03 Mar 2010 11:43:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Graphic Media Development]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="graphic-media-development"><![CDATA[Graphic Media Development]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=150</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Last week we was set the project of redesigning the artwork for one our favourite albums of the last decade. After much deliberation I chose the an album by Mark Ronson. The Song was a cover of a Maximo Park called "<em>Apply Some Pressure</em>" and even features the lead singer. I think I chose this song more because of the lyrics rather than anything else. Especially as when the album was released they had a particular meaning to me. A week after the project we all met up to show our work and get some feedback on what we had done, I am relatively pleased with he final out even if it isn't as polished as I would like it to be (being a one day project). The overall feed back was positive although there was some mention of a certain " clinical" style i seem to have  adopted so that is defiantly something to look out for in the future.

So Here is the Front Cover

<a href="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/03/album_cover2.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-154 alignleft" title="Album_Cover" src="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/03/album_cover2.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="300" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Seymourpowell</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/03/25/seymourpowell/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 25 Mar 2010 22:55:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[PDP]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="pdp"><![CDATA[PDP]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=194</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today we had a lecture from a previous student of the institute. He came to speak to us about the work he does now at seymourpowell and what he had to do to get there. Laurence Willmot graduated in 2007 and has been since working at seymourpowel. Although there was a lot of work he could not speak to us about due to the time scales involved in the projects,( The final idea may not some to fruition for several years) It was very interesting to me to find out how the design process works in such a big  company, and how there different departments work together. We were also lucky enough to get Lawrence on our own for a while to talk to him about his experiences as a student and what he done to get a job after graduating. There where 3 main points that stuck out to me;

1. Enter Competitions - The more you enter the more experience you get, and the more chance you have of being successful. Laurence entered his final major project from University into a number of competitions and got a lot of positive feedback.

2. Work Placements - Ultimately Laurence got the job as a result of a successful work placement over the space of two years.

3. Online Portfolio - <a href="http://www.insightoutsight.co.uk" target="_blank">insightoutsight</a> is the name of the online collaboration Laurence is involved in. It consists of a number of his uni friends which come together to display there personal work.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>194</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-03-25 22:55:06</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-03-25 22:55:06</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>seymourpowell</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Thames &amp; Hudson Trip</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/03/31/thames-hudson-trip/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 31 Mar 2010 20:00:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=170</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today I was invited to vist the london base of the publishers Thames &amp; Hudson. Earlier in the week we had met with David Jury and a select number of BA undergraduates where given the chance to attend the MA Design Students meeting in London.We were shown round by design director Aaron Hayden.  As part of the trip we was given a tour of the offices and were offered to ask any question we had on the business. As my first visit to publishers I was intrigued at the setup of the building and the workflow of the company. Each department was separated onto a different levels within the building with designer and researchers on one level, and everything from marketing to management on others. We was told that  it was quite unusal for a publishers to still have an in-house design department.This was mainly due to the finical comitment of employing full time team. One thought that stayed with me after the trip was how fluid the workflow was throughout the company. It was commented that many of the staff had worked in other departments at one time or another so there was a good understanding of what was needed at different stages of production. I think this fact, compiled with the seemingly loyal workforce and low turn over of staff (Some staff had been at the company for nearly 50 years) cemented the fact that there seemed to be a wealth of experience at hand at each stage of a job.

Aaron spoke very frankly about the industry, and the problems they faced. As a student I found that I benefited from this a lot, because too often I feel companies just offer the positive aspects of a certain job or industry. We spoke in some depth about how market conditions can effect the profit margins. Things like currency fluctuation as well as the price of raw materials such as paper and oil, can all have an effect when you have an international supply chain. All of these changes can eat into a the fragile profit margins of large companies. The price of paper going up a fraction of a penny on a book that has hundred of pages which sells millions of copies can have a tremendous effect. There is also the cost/price ratio of books. Each design decision has to be scrutinised over its cost to maximise the potential margin in a book. there is no point being over elaborate with printing techniques on a cheap book aimed at the student market.

I really feel that I gained a lot from this trip and I feel that it has cemented the direction I wish to pursuit in my career. I have a strong interest in digital media, and I think that by following this path I will avoid many of the negative effects of print based media.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Lakota Flyer Competiton</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/04/07/lakota-flyer-competiton-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 07 Apr 2010 17:12:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=178</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is my entry for the Lakota bar in chelmsford leaflet competition. The brief was to create the artwork for their july leaflet. This is my first attempt. I tried to keep it simple and appeal to what i considered to be the audience. I particaly liked the colours against the grey.

<a href="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/05/leflet2.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-179" title="Leflet2" src="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/05/leflet2.jpg?w=212" alt="" width="212" height="300" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Lakota Flyer Competiton</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/04/13/lakota-flyer-competiton/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 13 Apr 2010 15:01:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[My Work]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="my-work"><![CDATA[My Work]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=165</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is my final entry for the Lakota competition. I decided against my original idea after i realised that the look wasn't right for the cliental of the bar. I wanted to go with a raw look. This design also let me pay with some tag line ideas whichI rarely get to do. I Learnt a lot form this little project, namely that when you are dealing with commercial jobs its important to keep a handle on the amount of time and resource your are spending on one job.

<a href="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/04/aroot_lakota_june_leaflet.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-166" title="ARoot_Lakota_June_Leaflet" src="http://adroot.files.wordpress.com/2010/04/aroot_lakota_june_leaflet.jpg?w=210" alt="" width="210" height="300" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>165</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-04-13 15:01:14</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-04-13 15:01:14</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>lakota-flyer-competiton</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[10536232]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1273256710]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Pick Me Up - Somerset House</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/04/29/pick-me-up-somerset-house/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 29 Apr 2010 22:24:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=182</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today I went to the 'Pick Me Up' exhibition being put on at somerset house. After traveling straight from work I managed to get a quick look round before it closed on the penultimate day of the show. I was surprised to find out that most of the work on show was actually for sale. All though I found that a lot of the work interesting I came away with the feeling that there was a few very similar ideas running throughout. I think my two favourite artist from the show was <a href="http://www.misterrob.co.uk" target="_blank">Rob Ryan</a> and <a href="www.eveningtweed.com" target="_blank">Evening Tweed</a>. I first came across Rob Ryan at the MOMA in NewYork last November. I think his work is very original and incredible clever. I was lucky enough to by able to get hold of one of his limited edition cuts outs. You can see on every mark how intricate the skill is because if you make on mistake, a large piece of the work can be ruined. As for Evening Tweed, I thought there work showed the most unique use of typography and geometric shapes. So they get a thumbs up too. I would like to try and incorporate at least some of the influence i have seen into my Great Speeches work. If I could pull it off I think it would give me a much better skill base as well as adding a physical level to my designs.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>PDP Summary </title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/05/12/pdp-summary/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 12 May 2010 20:18:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[PDP]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="pdp"><![CDATA[PDP]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=186</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Although a little premature, here is my evaluation of my second year.

I think that the 2009/2010 academic year has been very important for me personally and professionally. As a designer I feel I have found my creative stride and have really began to embrace the opportunities that have come my way. One of the most fundamental changes has been my awareness of the historical and sociological importance of art and design in our society and how its role has changed over time. This has conceded with my greater understanding of art theory. I have also used the year to build upon my network of contacts, creating a digital portfolio, as well as a keeping a blog of my thoughts and influences.

My first task at the start for the year was to establish a base in which I could broadcast  myself to potential new clients and employers. I have tried to achieved this by creating a digital portfolio. Although I did have some prior experience in web design, I feel that this maybe the area that I have technically progressed the most. The process of researching what employers expect from a online portfolio, and what can be achieved was a very rewarding process for me. In doing so I have also been able to cement my knowledge of HTML and CSS as well as begin to understand Javascript and JQuery. I have since went on to create a blog, the main purpose of which is to record my thoughts and inspirations. I am natural very forgetful, and despite my best efforts I found that last year, I can often neglect key facts if I do not record my observation quickly. This has all changed with the use of Wordpress. I can instantly access my blog anywhere in the world and record information coherently and chronologically with the minimum amount of fuss.

After Attending all but one of the lectures held this year concerning art history and theory, I have found that I have got a much better handle on the complex issues involved within the subject. I particularly related to the recap seminars in which we revisited some of the subjects. I found it easier to ask questions throughout the lecture as opposed to doing so after. I felt that my new found knowledge has held me in good stead when researching different designers and artist as well allowing me to take a more critical view when visiting exhibitions.

One of my biggest successes of the year was securing a summer work placement at the graphic department of the foreign exchange company Moneycorp. I currently work part-time at Stansted Airport, in the retail division of the company. After helping with design work within my department I was encouraged to send a sample of my work to head office. Although the placement is only temporary at the moment I hope that it leads on to something that is more permanent. I have also pursued placements at Thames &amp; Hudson and as well as at Wunderman where I had a placement in 2007. Although Moneycorp is my only secure placement I feel that a lot can be learnt from working in a commercial environment. I also hope that by working in a relatively small team it will give the opportunity to turn my hand to a number of tasks and potential allow me to improve my web design skills.

Overall the biggest lessons I have learnt this year have ultimately  reinforced my passion for design and helped me concentrate on aspects of the industry I wish to pursue as a career.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Max Roberts Underground Map Lecture</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/09/22/max-roberts-underground-map-lecture/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Sep 2010 10:26:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://adroot.wordpress.com/?p=212</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today I attended the Underground Maps exhibition at the Minories in Colchester. While I was there my class and I were lucky enough to be given a talk by the creator of the exhibition, Max Roberts. Roberts has a background in physiology but has turned his attention to underground maps in the last 10 years. His main interests lie in improving the underground maps over all readability.

The exhibition starts with a brief history of the underground maps development. Initialy the underground network consisted of a number of different lines owned by separate companies. These maps followed the historical precedent by overlaying geographically accurate information on top of an odenice survey style map. Although this method had worked for overground trains and roads maps in the past, due to londons high concentration of train lines, reading the maps became more and more difficult.This trend continued until the appointment of Harry Beck in 1931. Beck was a underground employee who first realised that the map does not need to displayed in a geographicaly accurate fashion. It was under Becks guidance that the current format for the underground map was introduced. 

Roberts then when on to explain the basis of his research. The main problem addressed in this research is the necessary trade off between geographical accuracy and diagrammatic simplicity. It was was about half way through the talk that he was trying to solve a redundant problem. Ultimately there would alway be a discrepancies between the two. So instead of spending a disproportionate amount of time moderately refining the map. I feel it would be better to invest that time in a new way of displaying that information all together. If for example you displayed the map in a digital format, it would be possible to view multiple maps at one time eliminating the problem altogether.    ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>212</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-09-22 10:26:46</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-09-22 10:26:46</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>max-roberts-underground-map-lecture</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Summer Update</title>
		<link>http://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/10/14/summer-update/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Oct 2010 12:48:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[adroot]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://adroot.wordpress.com/2010/10/14/summer-update/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today is my first post of the third year. The summer has been a exciting time for me, I managed to gain some work experience with Moneycorp, which proved be very productive. A design I had been working while in knightsbridge has been chosen for use in the airport. All though the initial brief was only for an A3 poster the final print is well over two metres (pictures to follow).

I have also been working hard on my research for my FMP and dissertation. After much deliberation I think I have settled on a subject and for the most part a title. I have been spending a lot of time research information design, mapping and infographics, with particular reference to the internet. I feel this subject best sums up my career aspirations and should hopefully give me a platform in which to display my skills. I hope that due to the nature of the work and it's reliance on a large number of graphic applications, such as typography grid layouts ect, that it will accommodate most of the areas I am interested.

In the third year so far there has been a lot of talk specialising in a particular discipline. The main thinking behind this is that it can dramatically improves your chances of employment, If you focus all your efforts in one field, potentially you are a stronger candidate for a particular role as a posed to a 'Jack of all trades' designer which can turn their hands to most tasks but is a master of none. The point I take difference to is that because a designer can work with image placement, grids, typography, illustration and web design etc that they do not have a area specialty. Unfortunately my argument fell apart because I could not find a role which satisfied most of these skills,This was until I found information design. 
]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
